 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָטָר‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Exod.9.33|Exod 9:33]]</sup>. ==rain== (Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***me‰ru***</u></abbr>, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 406</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Sabean (Minaean) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מטר‎</span> [[BDB#Hom|Hom]]<sup>Chrestom. 127</sup>; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַטְרָא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Exod.9.33|Exod 9:33]] + 30 t.; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְטַר‎</span> [[Deut.11.11|Deut 11:11]] + 5 t.; plural construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִטְרוֺת‎</span> [[Job.37.6|Job 37:6]] — ***rain***, as watering earth, especially Canaan, [[Deut.11.11|Deut 11:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַשָּׁמַיִם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span>; as blessing sent (verb usually <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָתַן‎</span> and withheld by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> [[Deut.11.14|Deut 11:14]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יוֺרֶה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלְקוֺשׁ‎</span>); v[[Deut.11.17|Deut 11:17]] (here <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַרְצְכֶס‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְ‎</span>); [[Deut.28.12|Deut 28:12]]; [[1Kgs.8.35|1Kgs 8:35]]; [[1Kgs.8.36|1Kgs 8:36]]; [[1Kgs.17.1|1Kgs 17:1]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טַל‎</span>), [[1Kgs.18.12|1Kgs 18:12]]; [[1Chr.6.26|1Chr 6:26]]; [[1Chr.6.27|1Chr 6:27]]; [[1Chr.7.13|1Chr 7:13]]; [[Job.5.10|Job 5:10]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַיִם‎</span>), compare [[Job.28.26|Job 28:26]]; [[Job.36.27|Job 36:27]]; [[Ps.147.8|Ps 147:8]] (verb <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵכִין‎</span>); so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זַרְעֲךָ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְ‎</span> [[Isa.30.23|Isa 30:23]]; [[Zech.10.1|Zech 10:1]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלְקוֺשׁ‎</span>), v[[Zech.10.1|Zech 10:1]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְטַרגֶּֿשֶׁם‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גֶּשֶׁם מָטָר‎</span> [[Job.37.6|Job 37:6]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גֶּשֶׁם מִטְרוֺת עֻזּוֺ‎</span> v[[Job.37.6|Job 37:6]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׁלַג‎</span>); [[Job.38.28|Job 38:28]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶגְלֵיטָֿ֑ל‎</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּרָקִים לַמּ‎</span> [[Ps.135.7|Ps 135:7]]; [[Jer.10.13|Jer 10:13]] = [[Jer.51.16|Jer 51:16]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲמוֺן מַיִם‎</span>); also in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַרְצְךָ אָבָק וְעָפָר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָתַן אֵת מְ‎</span> [[Deut.28.24|Deut 28:24]] compare [[Isa.5.6|Isa 5:6]] (where accusative of congnate meaning with verb <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִמְטִיר‎</span>); wish of David [[2Sam.1.21|2Sam 1:21]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טַל‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּקָּצִיר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> simile of the unseasonable, [[Prov.26.1|Prov 26:1]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׁלֶג בַּקַּיִץ‎</span>); sent by extraordary supernatural power as sign [[Exod.9.33|Exod 9:33]]; [[Exod.9.34|Exod 9:34]] ([[BDB#J|J]]; both \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּרָר‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קֹלוֺת‎</span>) compare [[1Sam.12.17|1Sam 12:17]]; [[1Sam.12.18|1Sam 12:18]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קֹלוֺת‎</span>); simile of refreshment [[Deut.32.2|Deut 32:2]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טַל‎</span>), [[Job.29.23|Job 29:23]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַלְקוֺשׁ‎</span>), [[Ps.72.6|Ps 72:6]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רְבִיבִים‎</span>), compare [[2Sam.23.4|2Sam 23:4]] as destructive [[Ps.28.3|Ps 28:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָטָר סֹחֵף‎</span>); also figurative, [[Isa.4.6|Isa 4:6]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זֶרֶם‎</span>).
